exclusion: Tap the lower paddle on the switch 3 times quickly
inclusion:
TAP Upper paddle 3-5 TIMES QUICKLY

The LED indicator will blink to signal communication and remain on for 2 seconds to confirm inclusion
label: ZEN26
overview:
Manual or Z-Wave on/off control with instant status updates

Simple Direct 3-Way: connect with existing on/off switches in 3-way, 4-way, and 5-way set-ups, no add-on needed (neutral wire required)

Remembers and restores on/off status after power failure

LED indicator signals inclusion, exclusion, reset, and setting changes

Built-in Z-Wave Plus signal repeater to extend network range

Works with LED, CFL, and incandescent bulbs

S2 security protocol and the latest 500 Z-Wave chip for faster and safer wireless communication

Supported by most Z-Wave controllers
usage:
To complete factory reset process manually, tap-tap-tap’n’hold the upper paddle for at least 10 seconds. The LED indicator will flash to confirm successful reset. NOTE: All previously recorded activity and custom settings will be erased from the device’s memory.

MANUAL CONTROL

Upper Paddle: 

1 x tap: load on; Scene 1, attribute 00 (button 1)

2 x tap: Scene 1, attribute 03 (button 3)

3 x tap: enter inclusion (pairing) mode; Scene 1, attribute 04 (button 5)

4 x tap: Scene 1, attribute 05 (button 7)

6 x tap: change LED indicator mode (see parameter 2)

10 x tap: change physical / Z-Wave control mode (see parameter 11)

tap-tap-tap-and-hold: factory reset

Lower Paddle: 

1 x tap: load off; Scene 2, attribute 00 (button 2)

2 x tap: Scene 2, attribute 03 (button 4)

3 x tap: enter exclusion (unpairing) mode; Scene 2, attribute 04 (button 6)

4 x tap: Scene 2, attribute 05 (button 8)

tap-tap-tap-and-hold: factory reset

All ZEN26 switches can be updated via OTA firmware updates, here is how to do that. You can request a firmware update file here, please include your order number for verification!

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Paddle control
parameters.overview: Choose if you want the upper paddle to turn the light ON or turn the light OFF when tapped

parameters.label: LED indicator control
parameters.description: Change behavior of the LED indicator
parameters.overview: Choose if you want the LED indicator to turn on when the switch (light) is ON or OFF, or if you want it to remain ON or OIFF at all times. 6 x TAP PADDLE to manually change the LED indicator mode.

parameters.label: Auto turn-OFF timer
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-OFF timer function

parameters.label: Auto turn-OFF timer length
parameters.description: Length of time before switch turns OFF
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn OFF once it has been turned ON. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.

parameters.label: Auto turn-ON timer
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-ON timer function

parameters.label: Auto turn-ON timer length
parameters.description: Length of time before switch turns ON
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn ON once it has been turned OFF. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.

parameters.label: Association reports
parameters.overview:
Choose which physical and Z-Wave triggers should prompt the switch to send a status change report to associated devices.

Values: 

0 – none

1 – physical tap on ZEN26 only

2 – physical tap on connected 3-way switch only

3 – physical tap on ZEN26 or connected 3-way switch

4 – Z-Wave command from hub

5 – physical tap on ZEN26 or Z-Wave command from hub

6 – physical tap on connected 3-way switch or Z-Wave command from hub

7 – physical tap on ZEN26 / connected 3-way switch or Z-Wave command from hub

8 – timer only; 9 – physical tap on ZEN26 or timer

10 – physical tap on connected 3-way switch or timer

11 – physical tap on ZEN26 / connected 3-way switch or timer

12 – Z-Wave command from hub or timer

13 – physical tap on ZEN26, Z-Wave command from hub, or timer

14 – physical tap on ZEN26 / connected 3-way switch, Z-Wave command from hub, or timer

15 – all of the above (default)

options.label: Physical tap ZEN26, 3-way switch or Z-Wave
Physical tap ZEN26, 3-way switch or timer
Physical tap ZEN26, Z-Wave or timer
Physical tap ZEN26, 3-way switch, Z-Wave or timer

parameters.label: ON/OFF status after power failure
parameters.description: Set the ON/OFF status for the switch after power failure

parameters.label: Enable/disable scene control
parameters.overview: Enable or disable scene control functionality for quick double tap triggers

parameters.label: Enable/disable paddle control
parameters.description: Enable or disable local ON/OFF control
parameters.overview: Enable or disabvle local ON/OFF control. If enabled, you will only be able to control the connected light via Z-Wave. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through paddles.

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview: This device will send BINARY SWITCH REPORT to Group 1 and 2 when operated manually

associations.label: Group 2
associations.overview: This device will send BINARY SWITCH REPORT to Group 1 and 2 when operated manually
